column5: I get this list from time to time and it is always a PITA . Hiding or destroing it does not help, it reapear again in the least expected moment ( like hooking the boat to car )  . This time the list was very short, but when I've looked at it I  1. Laminate floor in one bedroom and foyer upstairs.  2. Hardwood (oak ) stairs.  No big deal with laminate but the stairs??????. Well, I can always turn to the pros. After getting some estimates  I've decided to do it myself ( I have some woodworking tools ) I've spent "few" hours in the garage cutting, glueing, jointing, planing, sanding, staining, and just today I've put final touches to the new stairs. I did it for about 1/3 of the lowest estimate. Constructive criticism accepted
Wow, fine work! This makes me even more pleased to be a teenager
Nice work Keram  Did you manufacture the bullnose on the stairs?  Very nice work...you deserve some time ont he ice now  Cheers  Craig
Very good, Now will your wife let you spend the savigs on something more important like fishing?   Way to go!!!
Fantastic job! I'm sure an appreciative wife will now allow you to spend the money you saved on whatever you want!!
Well it shows that hard work & patience goes along way !!! fantastic job,  it looks great !!! nothing looks better than nice shinny hardwood floors bud ....cheers
Thats gotta be worth at least a weekend on the water if you ask me.  Nice job
Great looking job keram that is no easy job  rob
Well done Keram  I'd say your earned a trip or two
Looks like real nice job there, Buddy. Do you hire out ???
Real nice work there, when you coming over for my house
Great work Keram!  I dont know the first thing about work like that, but I do know that it looks great!
